One: I judge others harshly: and myself even more severely.
Two: I put too much trust in those who wield power within my temple's hierarchy.
Three: My piety sometimes leads me to blindly trust those that profess faith in my god.
Four: I am inflexible in my thinking.
Five: I am suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of them.
Six: Once I pick a goal: I become obsessed with it to the detriment of everything else in my life.

One: I can't resist a pretty face.
Two: I'm always in debt. I spend my ill-gotten gains on decadent luxuries faster than I bring them in.
Three: I'm convinced that no one could ever fool me the way I fool others.
Four: I'm too greedy for my own good. I can't resist taking a risk if there's money involved.
Five: I can't resist swindling people who are more powerful than me.
Six: I hate to admit it and will hate myself for it: but I'll run and preserve my own hide if the going gets tough.

One: When I see something valuable: I can't think about anything but how to steal it.
Two: When faced with a choice between money and my friends: I usually choose the money.
Three: If there's a plan: I'll forget it. If I don't forget it: I'll ignore it.
Four: I have a "tell" that reveals when I'm lying.
Five: I turn tail and run when things look bad.
Six: An innocent person is in prison for a crime that I committed. I'm okay with that.

One: I'll do anything to win fame and renown.
Two: I'm a sucker for a pretty face.
Three: A scandal prevents me from ever going home again. That kind of trouble seems to follow me around.
Four: Despite my best efforts: I am unreliable to my friends.
Five: I once satirized a noble who still wants my head. It was a mistake that I will likely repeat.
Six: I have trouble keeping my true feelings hidden. My sharp tongue lands me in trouble.

One: The tyrant who rules my land will stop at nothing to see me killed.
Two: I'm convinced of the significance of my destiny: and blind to my shortcomings and the risk of failure.
Three: The people who knew me when I was young know my shameful secret: so I can never go home again.
Four: I have a weakness for the vices of the city: especially hard drink.
Five: Secretly: I believe that things would be better if I were a tyrant lording over the land.
Six: I have trouble trusting in my allies.

One: I'll do anything to get my hands on something rare or priceless.
Two: I'm quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
Three: No one must ever learn that I once stole money from guild coffers.
Four: I'm never satisfied with what I have - I always want more.
Five: I would kill to acquire a noble title.
Six: I'm horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine my handiwork. Everywhere I go: I'm surrounded by rivals.
